py_sim.launch.simple_sim module¶

simple_sim.py performs a test with a single vehicle

Provides an example of using a control law within the simulation with position and state plotting occurring actively during the movement of the vehicle.

class py_sim.launch.simple_sim.SimpleSim(initial_state: UnicycleStateType, dynamics: Dynamics[UnicycleStateType, InputType], controller: Control[UnicycleStateType, InputType, ControlParamType], control_params: ControlParamType, n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[UnicycleStateType])¶

Bases: Generic[UnicycleStateType, InputType, ControlParamType], SingleAgentSim[UnicycleStateType]

Framework for implementing a simulator that just tests out a feedback controller

dynamics¶

The dynamics function to be used for simulation

Type:

Dynamics[UnicycleStateType, InputType]

controller¶

The control law to be used during simulation

Type:

Control[UnicycleStateType, InputType, ControlParamType]

control_params¶

The parameters of the control law to be used in simulation

Type:

ControlParamType

update() → None¶

Calls all of the update functions

The following are updated:

  • Calculate the control to be executed

  • Update the state

  • Update the time

py_sim.launch.simple_sim.run_arc_example() → None¶

Runs an example of a vehicle executing an arc

Python Planning Sim
